definition: for fear that/lest/also written 唯恐

sentences.english: The mother tiptoed into the room for fear that she should wake up her sleeping baby.
sentences.chinese: 母親踮起腳尖走進房間，惟恐驚醒正在熟睡的寶寶。

sentences.english: They spoke in whispers lest they should be heard.
sentences.chinese: 他們低聲耳語惟恐被人聽見。

sentences.english: I am afraid of you, lest I have bestowed upon you labour in vain.
sentences.chinese: 我爲你們害怕，惟恐我在你們身上是枉費了工夫。

sentences.english: I closed the windows lest it should rain.
He is working hared for fear that he should fall behind others.
sentences.chinese: 他高興工作，惟恐落在他人後面。

sentences.english: He worked hard for fear that he might be fired by the boss.
sentences.chinese: 他拼命地幹活惟恐被老闆解僱。

sentences.english: George is jealous of his possessions.
sentences.chinese: 喬治惟恐失去他的財產。

sentences.english: His brutal nature, notorious, it is always less than fear.
sentences.chinese: 他兇殘成性，惡名遠播，人們總是避之惟恐不及。

sentences.english: She explained again and again lest others should misunderstand her.
sentences.chinese: 她再三解釋，惟恐大家誤會了她。

sentences.english: The father kept behind a pillar, so that he might not be seen.
sentences.chinese: 他父親，惟恐人家看見他，便待在這柱子後面。

sentences.english: The boy spoke in whisper lest Mr. Hall would blame him.
sentences.chinese: 男孩很小聲說話，惟恐霍爾先生責怪他。

sentences.english: I'm sure he understood, but he had to make affairs, being eager for the fray. Nonsense!
sentences.chinese: 他當然知道，就是爲了製造新聞，惟恐天下不亂。

definition: for fear that/lest/also written 惟恐
to fear/afraid/extremely nervous/for fear that/to avoid/so as not to
variant of 擔心|担心[dan1 xin1]
down to/up to/to such an extent as to .../also written 以至於|以至于[yi3 zhi4 yu2]
to be on tenterhooks (idiom)/to be anxious and frightened
to such an extent as to/down to/up to
hard to say/can't guarantee/difficult to protect/difficult to preserve
so as not to/so as to avoid
